title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
content:
Module 6, Lesson 9: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)

Introduction

This lesson covers Cross-Site Scripting (XSS), a core topic in Authentication & Security. Mastering this area will help you build reliable, scalable, and maintainable web applications.

Key Concepts

1. Fundamentals

Understanding the foundational principles of Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) ensures you can apply them correctly in a variety of real-world scenarios. Always prefer clarity over cleverness.

2. Practical Application

Theory must translate into working code. In Authentication & Security, every concept has direct practical implications for how you architect, test, and deploy applications.

3. Common Pitfalls

Awareness of common mistakes in Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) helps you avoid costly bugs and security vulnerabilities. Review real-world examples and practise defensive coding techniques.

4. Best Practices

Industry best practices evolve constantly. Keep up with community standards, read production post-mortems, and participate in code reviews to sharpen your skills in Authentication & Security.

Summary

You have completed Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in Module 6. Continue to the next lesson to build further expertise in Authentication & Security.
